intro: Sarcoglottis rupicola, commonly known as the rock sarcoglottis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
